Rômulo Meira-Góes

EE 483 - Introduction Robotics

Class Information - F24
  • Class Title: Introduction to Automation and Robotics Systems
  • Instructor: Rômulo Meira-Góes
  • Days: Time - TuTh 9:05AM - 10:20AM
  • Location: 101 N. Atherton St Bldg 101
  • Prereq: None necessary - Official prereq can be overridden
General Information

Learning robotics by building and programming a robot. Short lectures followed by lab where students work on the robots. The course is also design to be accessible to sophomore and junior undergraduate students.

Prerequisites

No prereq but it is recommended that students are familiar with some programming language, linear algebra and ordinary differential equations. For programming experience, Python or C++ are preferred but Matlab scripting is also fine.

Class Goals
  • Introduce with experiential learning basics concepts of robotics – hands-on robotics with autonomous vehicles robots
  • Use robotics topics – perception, kinematics, control, planning - to demonstrate mathematical concepts – linear algebra, ODE, programming
  • Expose advanced topics in EE that are related to robotics – control theory, computer vision, machine learning, sensing and actuating
  • Discuss the ethical principles and social impacts in the field robotics
Learning Outcomes
  • Describe and analyze robotic systems architecture
  • Develop complex robotic systems using the Robotic Operating System (ROS)
  • Apply coordinate transformations and robot kinematics to 2D and 3D systems
  • Explain and demonstrate standard perception and control algorithms
  • Apply best programming practices and principles
  • Recognize and identify ethical principles for robotics and social impacts of the field of robotics
